item.title: With Blockchain Technology, Where There's Smoke, There's Usually More Smoke - CoinDesk
item.description:
With Blockchain Technology, Where There's Smoke, There's Usually More Smoke - CoinDesk

Jonathan Wolinsky is senior managing director and chief scientist of Genesis Project, the company behind the private blockchain platform OpenBlock. In this opinion piece, Wolinsky - and colleague Robert Wolinsky - focus on the blockchain technology industry's inability to deliver on its promise: the bone crushing, market flattening creative destruction of the Bitcoin-style blockchain innovation.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Weekly Analysis -BTC/USD Above $700 Is Real? - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Weekly Analysis -BTC/USD Above $700 Is Real? - NEWSBTC

Bitcoin price surge was amazing, but BTC/USD is reaching a point where the bulls need to be very careful moving ahead. Bitcoin price surge was amazing, but BTC/USD is reaching a point where the bulls need to be very careful moving ahead. Bitcoin price continued to move higher and settled above the $700 mark against the US dollar.

item.description:

item.title: Ethereum Price Weekly Analysis - Can Decline Stop In ETH? - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Ethereum Price Weekly Analysis - Can Decline Stop In ETH? - NEWSBTC

Ethereum price declined heavily due to the DAO hack, and lost around 40% of the value. Can losses stop in ETH or will it continue to move down? Ethereum price declined heavily due to the DAO hack, and lost around 40% of the value. Can losses stop in ETH or will it continue to move down?

item.title: Stocks, Iron, Bitcoin - Silver Next For China? - ValueWalk
item.description:
Stocks, Iron, Bitcoin - Silver Next For China? - ValueWalk

The roulette game all started in the fall of 2014, about 2 years after Chairman Xi Jinping came to power and became the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China. Xi Jinping had campaigned for socialist economic reform, including a sweeping anti-corruption drive, cutting excess production capacity, tightening of housing credit, and clamping down on gaming in Macau.

item.title: Is it safe to use a second-hand Trezor (like from ebay)?
item.description:
Is it safe to use a second-hand Trezor (like from ebay)?

I just got a good price on a supposedly never used Trezor hardware wallet from eBay. I have no specific reason to think this would be dangerous to use, but I'm being cautious so thought I would ask

item.title: Walmart Canada and VISA Showdown, Will Bitcoin Emerge as the Winner? - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Walmart Canada and VISA Showdown, Will Bitcoin Emerge as the Winner? - NEWSBTC

The Walmart chain in Canada has announced that it will not be accepting VISA powered credit cards at its outlets from next month. Read more... Whenever there is an issue regarding fiat currency, bitcoin is sure to have the last laugh.

item.title: Do lawyers think the hacker who took $53M out of Ethereum will get to keep it?
item.description:
Do lawyers think the hacker who took $53M out of Ethereum will get to keep it?

Answer (1 of 2): It's not quite clear if this is a true "hack" or simply a badly designed system (and badly designed contract, to boot). It seems the "thief" is making the argument that the terms of the contracts (1) allowed him to make this transfer and (2) preclude the service changing to undo ...
